channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Hester Peirce: US crypto laws can’t assume ‘everything is a financial asset’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: SEC commissioner Hester Peirce discussed a possible U.S. crypto legal framework, giving a reminder that not all uses are financial.

item.title: Italy’s central bank calls for framework to prevent stablecoin runs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Bank of Italy is calling for closer regulator scrutiny of stablecoins, which they say “have not proved stable at all.”

item.title: FTX reboot on the way: CEO holds talks with ‘interested parties’ — Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: FTX is inching closer to a potential reboot, with CEO John Ray reportedly opening up the floor to bidders looking to finance the new venture.

item.title: Australian stock exchange may consider listing tokenized real-world assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The tokenized asset would need to be “appropriately backed” but could “absolutely” be listed in the future, said ASX chief information officer Dan Chesterman.

item.title: RBI lists risks of stablecoins for developing economies, calls for global regulation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India listed six specific ways a stablecoin can undermine emerging markets, adding to its mounting case against crypto.

item.title: Maple Finance announces direct lending to fill the void left by BlockFi, Celsius
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The lending platform’s team will begin offering loans directly to some borrowers instead of relying solely on pool delegates to provide capital.

item.title: Price analysis 6/28: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, SOL, LTC, MATIC, DOT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and several altcoins are stuck in a tight range, indicating that a breakout is brewing.

item.title: BIS, 3 central banks look at DeFi technology for wCBDC FX in interim project report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Project Mariana uses an automated market maker to reduce settlement risk and to create a liquidity pool in place of order books.

item.title: Staked ETH surpasses 23 million in June — Nansen
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Ethereum's staking ratio continues to rise since the network upgrade in April.

item.title: Germany launches dog-themed NFTs to fetch cyber talent: Nifty Newsletter, June 21–28
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The German foreign service created a dog-themed NFT collection in the form of a treasure hunt to recruit and test new cyber talent.

item.title: Will Bitcoin ever trade below $27,000 again?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: On this week’s episode of The Market Report, Cointelegraph’s resident expert discusses whether Bitcoin will ever be below $27,000 again. Have you missed your chance to purchase some sats at sub $30,000 levels?

item.title: Israeli authorities seize crypto from terror organizations, credit new technology
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Israeli ministries of defense and justice and a number of intelligence and enforcement agencies collaborated; Chainalysis also pitched in.

item.title: CFTC issues $54M default judgment against trader in crypto fraud scheme
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: As a result of the judgment, the defendant is also now prohibited from engaging in any trading activities within markets regulated by the CFTC and is barred from registering with the regulatory body.

item.title: $7.8B lost in crypto Ponzi and pyramid schemes in 2022: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Illicit activities related to crypto increased across the sector in 2022 despite an overall market downturn.

item.title: Bitcoin ETF race gets hotter as ARK Invest adds surveillance agreement to application
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: ARK Invest and 21Shares’ third application for a spot Bitcoin ETF now includes a surveillance sharing agreement.

item.title: Girlfriends, murdered kids, assassin androids — is AI cursed?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Artificial intelligence has provided the world with tools that might make life easier. But there has also been a slew of disturbing developments.

item.title: Bitcoin price clings to $30K as Fed’s Powell stresses more rate hikes
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: There’s no room for slacking when it comes to monetary policy tightening, Powell says, as Bitcoin takes a breather from yearly highs.

item.title: MicroStrategy buys $347M worth of Bitcoin amid market thaw
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: “DCA works,” wrote Binance CEO in response to the purchase.

item.title: How smart people invest in dumb memecoins: 3-point plan for success
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jillian Godsil
item.description: Serious crypto investors think memecoins are stupid. But smart people are making serious money from dumb memecoins. Here’s how.

item.title: Open source: Buzzword or real security for crypto wallets?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Anupam Varshney
item.description: Open-sourcing crypto wallet designs offers some benefits, but there are trade-offs as well.

item.title: European Commission aims for universal acceptance with digital euro proposal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: With this move, the European Commission aims to open up the payments market controlled by banks, Visa and Mastercard.

item.title: Paxos and MercadoLibre partner up to bring USDP to Mexico
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The move provides PAX coin access to Mexico’s 3.1 million-plus cryptocurrency users.

item.title: Tether signs MoU with Georgia to develop Bitcoin P2P infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The collaboration intends to bring changes to public administration and the business sector.

item.title: A brief history of the internet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Gain insights into the key milestones and trends that have shaped the internet into the global phenomenon it is today.

item.title: Bitcoin no longer crypto of choice for illicit crypto activity: TRM Labs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: While fiat channels remain the dominant tool for criminal financing, Bitcoin appears to have fallen out of favor for criminals as far as cryptocurrencies go.

item.title: Voyager to pay $1.1M in legal fees incurred in April
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Certain members holding high positions within the firm bill an hourly rate exceeding $2,000 for their professional services.

item.title: EU finalizes controversial smart contract kill switch rules under Data Act
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The Data Act was first proposed in early 2022 and passed by the European Parliament on March 14.

item.title: KuCoin crypto exchange to introduce mandatory KYC in July
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: KuCoin’s Know Your Customer checks will require new users to complete identity verification to access all services, while existing non-KYC users will not be able to deposit.

item.title: Ethereum price won’t see $2K anytime soon, market data suggests
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Weak derivatives metrics, and declining TVL and DApps use, put Ethereum bears in a better position to keep ETH price below $2,000.

item.title: Sony Network invests in Japanese Web3 startup to spur mass adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The deal includes an investment of $3.5 million, a Sony executive moving to Startale Labs and collaboration on new Web3 tools for mass adoption.
